statute_citation: South Dakota Codified Laws (SDCL) Title 1, Chapter 27 - Public Records and Files
notes: Presumption favoring disclosure since 2009. Office of Hearing Examiners provides administrative appeals. No specific response timeline mandated, but 'as soon as practicable' standard applies. Formal requests must be by hard copy mail.

basic_request.subject: Public Records Request - South Dakota Sunshine Law
basic_request.body:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the South Dakota Sunshine Law, SDCL Title 1, Chapter 27, I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

Under South Dakota law, all citizens and other interested persons have the right to inspect public records. Please make these records available as soon as practicable.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide written explanation citing the specific exemption under SDCL 1-27-1.5 or other applicable law.

I understand that fees may be charged for actual costs of reproduction, mailing, and staff time exceeding one hour. Please provide an estimate if extensive costs are anticipated.

I prefer to receive responsive records in electronic format when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if you need clarification regarding this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: Public Records Dispute - Office of Hearing Examiners Review
appeal_template.body:
TO THE OFFICE OF HEARING EXAMINERS:

Pursuant to SDCL 1-27-38 through 1-27-43, I hereby request administrative review of a denial of access to public records by [AGENCY NAME].

REQUEST DETAILS:
Date of Request: [DATE]
Agency: [AGENCY NAME]
Custodian: [CUSTODIAN NAME]
Records Requested: [DESCRIPTION]

VIOLATION:
The agency [DESCRIBE VIOLATION - denied request / failed to respond within reasonable time / charged excessive fees / etc.]. This violates the South Dakota Sunshine Law, SDCL Chapter 1-27.

[If denial] The agency cited [EXEMPTION CLAIMED], but this exemption under SDCL 1-27-1.5 does not apply because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records are public records subject to disclosure.

RELIEF REQUESTED:
I respectfully request the Office of Hearing Examiners:
1. Review this denial and find that the agency violated South Dakota public records law;
2. Order the agency to provide access to the requested records;
3. Award costs and attorney's fees if the agency acted unreasonably;
4. Issue any other appropriate relief.

Alternatively, I may pursue civil action in circuit court within 90 days of the denial.

Attached: Copy of original request and agency response

Respectfully submitted,
[YOUR NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[PHONE]
[EMAIL]

Submit to:
Office of Hearing Examiners
Pierre, SD 57501
